p: Even if the research about stigma was created earlier, the first full description of the stigma was given by Goffman’s work [ 5], Stigma: Notes on the Management of a Spoiled Identity, in 1963. Stigma is a social label that bans subjects from the full acceptance of the society in which they live (Goffman [ 5], 1963, p. 3), and it is defined as “an attribute that links a person to an undesirable stereotype, leading other people to reduce the bearer from a whole and usual person to a tainted, discounted one (p. 11)”.
